sentence.Network_en: In many societies women are subordinate to men.
sentence.Network_cn: 在许多社会中，妇女都从属于男人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin subordinatus 'placed in an inferior rank', from Latin sub- 'below' + ordinare 'ordain'

entry.def: If someone is your subordinate, they have a less important position than you in the organization that you both work for.

example.ex: Haig tended not to seek guidance from subordinates...
Nearly all her subordinates adored her.
example.tran: 几乎所有的下属都崇拜她。

entry.def: Someone who is subordinate to you has a less important position than you and has to obey you.

example.ex: Sixty of his subordinate officers followed his example...
example.tran: 他的60个下级官员都以他为榜样。

example.ex: Women were regarded as subordinate to free men.
example.tran: 过去女人被认为是从属于自由民的。

entry.def: Something that is subordinate to something else is less important than the other thing.

example.ex: It was an art in which words were subordinate to images.
example.tran: 这是一种形象胜于语言的艺术。

entry.def: If you subordinate something to another thing, you regard it or treat it as less important than the other thing.

example.ex: He was both willing and able to subordinate all else to this aim.
example.tran: 为了这个目标他愿意并能够把其他一切都放在次要的位置。

means.word_mean: 1. an assistant subject to the authority or control of another
2. a word that is more specific than a given word
1. rank or order as less important or consider of less value;

sentences.sentence: "Art is sometimes subordinated to Science in these schools"
"Our wishes have to be subordinated to that of our ruler"

means.word_mean: 2. subject or submissive to authority or the control of another;
3. of a clause; unable to stand alone syntactically as a complete sentence;

sentences.sentence: "a subordinate (or dependent) clause functions as a noun or adjective or adverb within a sentence"

auth_sentence.content: George had to content himself with a subordinate position.
auth_sentence.res_content: George had to content himself with a subordinate position.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: George had to content himself with a subordinate position.

auth_sentence.content: Lord Cardigan's...behaviour towards his subordinate officers was notorious.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lord Cardigan's...behaviour towards his subordinate officers was notorious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lord Cardigan's...behaviour towards his subordinate officers was notorious.

auth_sentence.content: Passive analysis will be subordinate to active experimentation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Passive analysis will be subordinate to active experimentation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Passive analysis will be subordinate to active experimentation.

stems_affixes.word_buile: co共同+ordin顺序+ate表动词,也表示形容词→顺序一样→同等的,引申为平等;协调
in无+ordin命令,顺序+ate……的→无顺序的→过度的
in不+subordinate服从的→adj.不服从的,反抗的
ordin命令,顺序+al……的→adj.顺序的,依次的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 普通的,平凡的,平常的;平庸的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ordin命令,顺序+ary……的→有顺序的;听命令的→普通的
sub下面,副手+ordin顺序+ate……的→顺序在下→附属的
coordinate[v.协调 adj.同等的;座标]+or人→n.协调者,同等的人或物
ordin命令,顺序+ance表名词→命令[状态]→法令
co共同+ordin顺序+ate表动词,也表示形容词→顺序一样→同等的,引申为平等;协调

means.word_mean: 级别或职位较低的, 下级的

sentences.en: A private is subordinate to a corporal.
All other considerations are subordinate to our need for steady profits.
sentences.cn: 比起我们需要稳定的利润来说, 其他需要考虑的事都是次要的。

jushi.english: You must subordinate your private interests.
jushi.chinese: 你必须将个人利益放在次要地位。
